Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-weight: 400;&quot;&gt;Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Sales at Brex&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;Sales is the growth engine at Brex. We bring in new customers, expand existing relationships, and drive the company’s bottom line. With unlimited territories and uncapped opportunity, your ambition sets the ceiling. We win together, celebrate often, and reward performance. If you want to sell a category-defining product with real ownership, this is your team.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;What you’ll do&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;As an Expansion Account Executive, you’ll own a portfolio of high-value accounts within Brex’s Enterprise and Upper Mid-Market segments. Your role will be pivotal in fostering business expansion and ensuring sustained client success through disciplined execution, strategic influence, and consultative engagement.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Where you&#39;ll work&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;This role will be based in our Salt Lake City office. We are a hybrid environment that combines the energy and connections of being in the office with the benefits and flexibility of working from home. We currently require a minimum of two coordinated days in the office per week, Wednesday and Thursday. Starting February 2, 2026, we will require three days per week in office - Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. As a perk, we also have up to four weeks per year of fully remote work!&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Responsibilities&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive revenue growth across your book by strategically increasing card adoption and expanding client use of Brex’s Spend Management suite (Expense Management, Bill Pay, Travel, and global payments)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Drive long-term retention by understanding client health and business needs, proactively developing and executing strategies to mitigate churn risk and solidify partnerships&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proactively identify and prioritize expansion opportunities by analyzing account performance, usage headroom, and competitive signals&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Lead renewal and expansion cycles end-to-end, from early account strategy through negotiation and close, ensuring strong commercial outcomes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Build executive-level relationships and multi-thread across stakeholders (finance, procurement, and operations) to strengthen account resilience, act as a trusted advisor, and uncover new areas for adoption and growth&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Operate with ownership, anticipating client needs, addressing risks early, and taking accountability for revenue and retention outcomes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Partner cross-functionally with Customer Success, Solutions Consultants, Underwriting, RevOps, and Product to deliver unified client outcomes&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Maintain rigorous sales discipline with consistent pipeline hygiene, accurate forecasting, and comprehensive account planning.&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Surface insights and advocate for clients internally, influencing product roadmap and operational improvements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Solve complex problems with judgment and creativity, converting competitive threats or risks into opportunities for retention and expansion&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Requirements&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;3+ years of B2B closing experience in SaaS, payments, or financial technology&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proven success managing enterprise-level accounts with complex deal cycles, executive engagement, and multi-threaded relationships&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Consistent record of exceeding quota and delivering top performance in competitive sales environments&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Demonstrated mastery of renewal and expansion cycles, including high-value negotiations and competitive displacements&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Track record of driving net revenue growth through upsell, cross-sell, and adoption of multi-product solutions&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Proficiency with sales tools and systems such as Salesforce, Outreach, and Gong, with strong pipeline and forecast discipline&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Preferred qualifications&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ul&gt; &lt;li&gt;Deep knowledge of corporate cards, underwriting, rewards, or credit risk management&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Experience selling financial operations platforms (expense, travel, AP, or global payments)&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Recognition as a top performer (President’s Club, top stack rank, etc.) in prior roles&lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt;Exposure to enterprise procurement processes and competitive SaaS/fintech sales cycles&lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ul&gt; &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Compensation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p&gt;The expected OTE range for this role is $146,400 - $183,000. The starting wage will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. The OTE figure listed here includes base salary and commissions, which may or may not be earned depending on performance.&amp;nbsp; Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;content-conclusion&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a&amp;nbsp;&lt;a class=&quot;c-link&quot; href=&quot;http://brex.com/&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; data-stringify-link=&quot;http://brex.com&quot; data-sk=&quot;tooltip_parent&quot;&gt;brex.com&lt;/a&gt;&amp;nbsp;domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

job_description: Legal Counsel, Audiobook LicensingNew York, NY / Miami, FL / LondonLegal – Legal /Permanent /HybridApply for this jobWe are seeking a Legal Counsel with strong audiobook licensing experience to join our Legal Licensing & BD Team. As legal counsel in our legal audiobook licensing team you will work closely with our publisher partnership team on the business side, negotiating and drafting audiobook licenses with major and independent book publishers and providing day-to-day legal input on business and strategy related to Spotify’s audiobook initiative. Our work is cutting edge, fast-paced and always evolving, so we are looking for an innovative, dynamic and proactive problem-solver to join our team.What You'll DoProvide strategic, tactical legal advice related to audiobook rights in a creative, business-centric way.Support and advise our publisher-facing and author teams on legal audiobook licensing matters.Structure, draft, and negotiate audiobook license agreements. Serve as a subject matter expert on the legal obligations related to audiobook content. Collaborate with internal legal and product teams to assess new audiobook initiatives and innovations in relation to contractual obligations with external publishing partnersAct as the day-to-day legal support for Spotify’s commercial relationship with top book publishers globally!Who You AreUS or UK qualified lawyer with 7+ years of relevant law firm and/or in-house counsel transactional experience.Excellent legal analytical skills and strong working knowledge of copyright law and legal issues relating to the audiobook space, including experience negotiating and drafting complex content licensing agreements between digital services and book publishers.Strong commercial acumen with a practical, business-oriented approach to problem-solving and ability to effectively counsel business teams by providing pragmatic, commercial and timely advice.Ability to be nimble and work in a fast-paced environment with changing needs and demanding timelines.An excellent communicator who excels at relationship building and expectation management. You have strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills and the ability to express thoughts logically and succinctly. You are a self-starter with a proven track record of executing complex projects and have solid organizational and project management skills. You embody Spotify’s values (Innovative, Collaborative, Sincere, Passionate, Playful) and demonstrate a Growth Mindset.You are passionate about audiobooks and invested in contributing to the growth and success of authors and the format at large on our platform.Spanish language proficiency welcome.Where You'll BeThis position is located in either New York, Miami or London, UK. We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in-person meetings, but it still allows for flexibility to work from home. The United States base range for this position is $170,366.00 - $243,380, plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six-month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, paid flexible holidays, and paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-noticeApply for this job
